section.section:
A procurement officer shall reject a bid or proposal if the procurement officer determines that:
the bid is nonresponsive or the proposal is unacceptable; or
the bidder or offeror is not responsible.
The procurement officer shall include a determination under this subsection in the procurement file.

text.section:
If, with the approval of the Board, a unit determines that it is fiscally advantageous or otherwise in the best interests of the State, the unit may:
cancel an invitation for bids, a request for proposals, or other solicitation; or
reject all bids or proposals.

A procurement officer may determine that a person is not a responsible bidder or offeror for:
unreasonable failure to supply information promptly in connection with a determination of responsibility under subsection (a) of this section; or
any other reason indicating that the person does not have:
the capability in all respects to perform fully the requirements for a procurement contract; or
the integrity and reliability that will ensure good faith performance.
